instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
the macbook work fine with battery, not charging, not voltage on charging port.
when charger connection PPBUS is 1.5v no short of course.
all the CHGR lines is 0v no short.
changing ports don't do the work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
What shows USB-C meter?
Do you get any voltage at FF200/1 and <RESISTOR>R5220</RESISTOR>?

Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 94928, member: 682"]
What shows USB-C meter?
[/QUOTE]
nothing black screen,.

FF200/1 and <RESISTOR>R5200</RESISTOR> 0v - no short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at pins CC1/2 of UF400/500.
Also at FF200/1 and <RESISTOR>R5220</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
"nothing black screen"
How do you get 1.5V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> then?

What about <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC0</SIGNAL>/1?
Check voltage and diode mode.
DF602/22 may be bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
"DF602/22 may be bad."
Remove and test again.
Can also be the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips (UF400/500).

Tell the client to use ORIGINAL charger...
